project.teaser: With 75% of the EU’s citizens living in urban areas, the potential of circular economy for European cities is clear. However, one of the main issues hindering a widespread deployment is that compared to industrialized economies, circular economy business cases are often...
project.objective: With 75% of the EU’s citizens living in urban areas, the potential of circular economy for European cities is clear. However, one of the main issues hindering a widespread deployment is that compared to industrialized economies, circular economy business cases are often perceived as risky by investors, often because the business models are poorly described or understood. InvestCEC will develop a replicable model for the implementation of circular economy projects in cities and regions across Europe, while taking into account all relevant stakeholders. Specifically, the model will address the city and region’s needs, support entrepreneurs in making their circular economy solution investment ready, and include the investment program set up and management. The model viability will be then demonstrated in the city of Klagenfurt, Austria as a test case. InvestCEC will also develop a platform for the stakeholders involved in a circular economy project to communicate, exchange information, as well as monitor the project and its progress. A tailored replication plan including replication materials and replication activities will be established in order to encourage the replication of the model in other local and regional settings across Europe. Alongside the model’s development and demonstration, the project will carry out prospective activities and implement measures to support the transition towards circular economy, including policy-related work, information exchange events, marketplace of circular economy solutions, and additional resources, tools and guidelines for the use of all stakeholders.
project.title: Supporting the transition towards circular economy in European cities and regions: Development of a replicable model for local circular economy projects
project.keywords: Waste management, rereplication, circular cities, circular regions, CCRI, imapct investments, circular economy investments, replicated model, circular economy policy

result.title: Replication plan for investment model at national and European level
result.description: A plan outlining the replication materials and replication activities that will be carried out in the project. Specifically, it will include details about the planning and development of the guidebook and national and European replication manuals, and additional replication material and activities (e.g., networking activities) at Austrian and European level. The reference task is T3.2. The measures and activities described in the plan will be realized as part of the work in T3.2 and the project's dissemination activities (the guidebooks, manuals and other replication materials will be developed and disseminated to relevant stakeholders) in T4.3, as well as through the support and facilitation measures described in T3.3.

result.title: Summary of support and facilitation measures and activities – Mid project
result.description: A report outlining all activities taken in as part of the stakeholder capacity building efforts,monitoring and seizing funding opportunities, the marrketplace activities and all support measures developed and delivered in the project, as well as any obsereved outcomes of the activities. The reference tasks are sub-tasks T3.3.1 and T3.3.3.

result.title: Report on a model for initiation and implementation of circular economy projects – Initial version
result.description: This deliverable will report on the initiation of the demonstration of the model, including timing, relevant materials, challenges and solutions and foreseen next steps. This will include the financial, technological, strategical suppport measures and actions provided by InvestCEC to make projects investment ready. The reference tasks are T2.1 and its sub-tasks T2.1.1 through 2.1.5 ,T2.2 and T2.3.

result.title: Plan for dissemination and exploitation including communication activities - Initial version
result.description: An objective-oriented plan for dissemination, communication and exploitation of project results, aiming at maximizing the project’s impact. Will be constantly updated during the project. The reference tasks are T4.1, T4.2, T4.3 and T4.4.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - InvestCEC (Supporting the transition towards circular economy in European cities and regions: Development of a replicable model for local circular economy projects)
result.teaser: The circular economy is one of the core principles of the EU’s Green Deal. But a significant hurdle in getting circular economy projects off the ground is funding, as these projects are often classified as high-risk. InvestCEC will develop a replicable model for the...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Data Management Plan – Initial version
result.description: Description of the type of data generated, collected and/or (re)used, and compliance with FAIR principles. The reference task is T1.4.

result.title: Circular economy investments - Financial barriers and potential measures to address them
result.description: Report on the identified financial, investment-related barriers to the transition towards circular economy in cities and regions, and selected measures to ivercome such challenges. The reference task T3.1.

result.title: Project website
result.description: A constantly updating dedicated website including information on the project and progress, including objectives, work plan, results and resource. The reference task is T4.2.

result.title: Detailed online platform functional and technical specifications
result.description: A guidebook on the stakeholder platform including specifications, features and technical information that will allow the replication of the platform. The reference task is and T2.2.

result.title: InvestCEC Guide for Investors: Investing in the Circular Economy
Mid-term policy recommendations brief
result.description: Policy recommendation report, outlining InvestCEC's experience-based advise for policy makers to promote the transition towards circular economy at the city/region level. The reference task is sub-task T3.3.2

result.title: Model and tools for urban/regional circular economy projects – Version 1
result.description: The first version of the complete model, including a description of the model and guidelines for the implementation of the different stages, replication materials for each stage (e.g., template for needs defintion for the first stage, template for interested entrepreneurs to describe their offered solution for the second stage, guidelines for preparing business case and business plans for the third stage, gidelines on applying the model's investment program for stage four). The reference tasks are T2.1 and its sub-tasks T2.1.1 through T2.1.5.

result.title: Circular Economy Solution Areas for Urban/Regional Settings

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
